Here's the extracted text from the SAT page:

### Section 1, Module 1: Reading and Writing 
**Directions**  

The lack of accessible written sources is a common challenge faced by biographers of pre-nineteenth-century subjects. _____ when writing his biography of Alexander Hamilton (1755–1804), historian Ron Chernow had at his disposal Harold Syrett’s 26-volume, 19,000-document *Papers of Alexander Hamilton*.

22. Which choice completes the text with the most logical transition?  
A. To take one well-known example,  
B. In accordance with this premise,  
C. It thus came as no surprise that,  
D. On the other end of the spectrum,

questions.passage_text: The lack of accessible written sources is a common challenge faced by biographers of pre-nineteenth-century subjects. _____ when writing his biography of Alexander Hamilton (1755–1804), historian Ron Chernow had at his disposal Harold Syrett’s 26-volume, 19,000-document *Papers of Alexander Hamilton*.
questions.question_text: Which choice completes the text with the most logical transition?
options: A. To take one well-known example,
B. In accordance with this premise,
C. It thus came as no surprise that,
D. On the other end of the spectrum,
questions.explanation: The question requires identifying the transition that contrasts the general challenge with Hamilton's specific case.
